title: 12g Mugen Technique
preparation_steps: Add coffee to V60 and tare scale

brewing_steps.audio_script: Start timer. Pour 40 grams for the bloom. You have 45 seconds. Wet all the grounds evenly.
Pour in a controlled spiral to reach 100 grams by 1 minute 15 seconds. Focus on keeping the water in the center to avoid the edges.
Second pour. Continue spiraling to reach 160 grams by 1 minute 50 seconds. Keep the stream central.
Final pour. Reach 200 grams by 2 minutes 20 seconds. Let it draw down.
Allow the coffee to draw down completely. It should finish just past the 3 minute mark.

what_to_expect.description: Inspired by the Hario Mugen brewer, this technique uses controlled central spiral pours to minimize bypass. By keeping the water away from the filter walls, we force it through the coffee bed, increasing extraction efficiency for small doses.
what_to_expect.audio_script: This technique borrows from the Mugen brewer concept. By pouring in tight spirals and avoiding the walls, we force the water through the coffee bed instead of around it, solving the bypass issue common with small doses.

notes: The mugen (spiral) technique is specifically designed to reduce bypass issues in small doses by keeping the water contained in a central area.
